titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Queens County Court of General Sessions of the Peace record 1977.106
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham

did.unittitle: Queens County Court of General Sessions of the Peace record

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Queens County (N.Y.). Court of General Sessions of the Peace

did.abstract: A decision issued by the Queens County Court of General Sessions of the Peace, dated 1799. The case in question concerned a John Schenck of the town of North Hempstead, Long Island, who sought the court's approval to manumit (or free) an enslaved African-American man named Prince.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. This item was formally accessioned in 1977.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Queens County Court of General Sessions of the Peace record, 1977.106, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A decision issued by the Queens County Court of General Sessions of the Peace, dated 1799. The case in question concerned a John Schenck of the town of North Hempstead, Long Island, who sought the court's approval to manumit (or free) an enslaved African-American man named Prince. The court ruled in favor of Schenck and allowed Prince to be freed. The document lists the names of all the judges and lawyers involved with the case.
